body_html: Yes, it looks like the bindings in Session.java are missing the equivalent of a target argument. For a pure-Java solution, we'd also want some bindings for the equivalent of Python's tf.train.Server, which should be fairly easy to add—but right now they are part of the "no stability guarantees" C++ API, rather than the stable C API.
body_text: Yes, it looks like the bindings in Session.java are missing the equivalent of a target argument. For a pure-Java solution, we'd also want some bindings for the equivalent of Python's tf.train.Server, which should be fairly easy to add—but right now they are part of the "no stability guarantees" C++ API, rather than the stable C API.
body: Yes, it looks like the [bindings in `Session.java`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/28091dce41045570b7d92eb912eddce0079c0234/tensorflow/java/src/main/java/org/tensorflow/Session.java#L51) are missing the equivalent of a `target` argument. For a pure-Java solution, we'd also want some bindings for the equivalent of Python's `tf.train.Server`, which should be fairly easy to add—but right now they are part of the "no stability guarantees" C++ API, rather than the stable C API.
